> 29 minutes ago, pap1723 said:
> 
> 
> Hi [@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/)!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> If I haven't said it before, thank you for SSTU and I love all of the work you have done. It is one of my must have mods that I need to play with!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I am using this in Realism Overhaul RP-0 and the way it works, the limits on the tank sizes are not necessary to upgrade like in stock. They should be available from the beginning.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I have messed around with creating <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches with the TECHLIMITS information, but I CANNOT get the max and minimum tank sizes available from the beginning, can you help me with my stupidity?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Pap
> 

That is because the TECHLIMIT system is no longer in use.  The fuel tanks (and MSRB and other parts) now use the stock PartUpgrade system.

What you would need to do is remove the UPGRADES block from the MFT parts 'SSTUModularFuelTank' module.  This entire block would need to be removed:

    	UPGRADES{	UPGRADE	{		name__ = SSTU-MFT-D1		maxTankDiameter = 1.875	}	UPGRADE	{		name__ = SSTU-MFT-D2		maxTankDiameter = 2.5	}	UPGRADE	{		name__ = SSTU-MFT-D3		maxTankDiameter = 3.125	}	UPGRADE	{		name__ = SSTU-MFT-D4		maxTankDiameter = 3.75	}	UPGRADE	{		name__ = SSTU-MFT-D5		maxTankDiameter = 6.25	}	UPGRADE	{		name__ = SSTU-MFT-D6		maxTankDiameter = 10	}	UPGRADE	{		name__ = SSTU-MFT-M1		minTankDiameter = 0.625	}}

Might be as simple as:  

(untested)

    @PART[SSTU-SC-TANK-MFT-A]
    {
      @MODULE[SSTUModularFuelTank]
      {//remove the upgrades nodes from the part
        -UPGRADES{}//set the min and max tank diameters explicitly
        %minTankDiameter = 0.625
        %maxTankDiameter = 20
      }
    }

It really is a very interesting mod for game mechanics, in regards to the mass of supplies I'll tag [@ShotgunNinja](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/159391-shotgunninja/) here and see what he says. I would strongly recommend you to try it, best with a new install and only install the mods that it currently supports as it changes very core modules such as electric charge, ModuleScience and ModuelDataTransmitter.

I made a comment in his thread, actually, a while ago. I think he's using RL values, and I think they should likely be downscaled to reflect the tiny stature of kerbals.

In stock KSP, it likely doesn't matter as all the craft are grossly over-capable. In a scaled system, the mass would become prohibitive, I think. Regardless, it's a very cool looking mod ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif ":0.0:") .

The main reason I'm asking is because, after looking in the GitHub repo, I can make out some of what's needed, but in no way can I find them all without many, many, errors and quite a bit of time with trail-and-error. I'm also not just asking this for myself, but I believe many others would like easy access to extraordinary engines as well. Some users may lack the time to cherry pick out every asset for the engines and mounts to work properly. Other users may not be very computer literate, so they wouldn't know were to look, or even others that don't have the understanding of a config when reading part / <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> files.

I was hoping @Shadowmage, or anyone else generous enough that's more familiar with the structure of this mod; thus being much more proficient at gathering the correct assets, would make the engine + mount pack.

I'm usually not the one to ask for something like this, but the folder structure, and the amount of other assets for completely different parts in the general vicentidy didn't help when I tried doing this myself...

Sorry for the long post, but I do hope either @Shadowmage, or some other generous user will read this, and possibly make it a reality. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Thanks for your time.

Managed to find / create a solution to the lack of proper shader support on the editor-part icons.  This required creating a new custom icon shader that mimicked the stock icon shaders specialized functionality, while having all of the extra texture slots and functions of the masking shader.  As a result, the part-icons now have proper specular, AO, and preset-mask colors:

![VcKVINw.png](http://i.imgur.com/VcKVINw.png)

A bit of a random screenshot showing some of what the new masking system will be capable of (and some of the new mask layouts), and what has been taking up so much of my time recently (and why there have been no recent releases/no releases coming in the immediate future):

![vnMSkl5.png](http://i.imgur.com/vnMSkl5.png)

Still a lot of work to do on the remaining mount textures/masks, and a bit of cleanup work on a few of the tank textures.  Still have the MSRB and MUS parts to rework as well, but they should go fairly quickly compared to what has already been done.  I have not yet seen any hints of when 1.3 will be officially out, but it is probably safe to say that this stuff won't be ready until sometime -after- 1.3 is released.

I use SSTU parts almost exclusively. Nobody said that they can't be used without the rest of the pack.  They most certainly can be.  You merely need to be willing to put forth a bit of effort as that is not the intended use of the mod.  As was quoted above, if you can provide a exact list of parts that you want to keep, I can let you know what assets and configs can be kept/removed (and why, as sometimes it is not obvious why a model/texture/config is necessary).

For a quick estimation, for keeping only engines, you would need to keep:

- the engine model, texture, and part-config files for each engine you want to keep (from /assets and /parts/shipcore/engines)
- the engine mount models, textures, and model definition config files (from /assets, and /data/modeldata)
- plugin folder + .dll
- FX folder
- most of the other non-part/model configs found in the '/data' folder (some are needed for the SSTU plugin to startup properly).
- real-plume configs from the mod-integration folder if RP is desired.

If you want SRBs as well... it gets much more complicated.

[@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/)

I'd really just like the engines and maybe the mounts if they provide anything special. For the <abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster">SRB</abbr>'s, I can use stock parts plus other from other mod packs.
